definition: Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (1835-1908), regent 1861-1908

sentences.english: Shou was bestowed by Empress Dowager Cixi when she presented the Empress with the embroidered tapestry, Eight Immortals Celebrating Birthday.
sentences.chinese: 壽被賦予慈溪太后她皇后繡掛毯，八老慶祝生日。

sentences.english: After eating the fine snack, Empress Dowager Cixi was fairly satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧太后吃了這精美的點心之後，很滿意。

sentences.english: Empress Dowager of the palace and gardens from the withers not a dewy rose.
sentences.chinese: 皇太后的花園及行宮是從不曾凋謝的一支帶露玫瑰。

sentences.english: Is furthermore small and soft to calculate, queen mother this undertaking really has already lost advisability.
sentences.chinese: 再者細細推算，太后此舉委實有失明智。

sentences.english: The Dowager Duchess of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha continued to reside in Coburg.
sentences.chinese: 在薩克森公爵夫人太后科堡與哥達繼續居住在科堡。

sentences.english: I had thought that our Empress Dowager was Queen of the world.
sentences.chinese: 我以爲皇太后是這個世界的女王。

sentences.english: Even the Dowager had not been as incompetent.
sentences.chinese: 西太后本人當時並非是無能爲力的。

sentences.english: The queen mother waved to the crowd.
Pei Hong greeted the Empress as Empress Dowager. Did you all hear that?
sentences.chinese: 裴洪叫皇后爲皇太后，你們聽見了？

sentences.english: While the Queen Mother was eating dinner, Protestants burst in to demand justice.
sentences.chinese: 正值王太后用餐時，新教徒們衝了進去要求伸張正義。

sentences.english: Each panel has on its reverse side the royal monogram of the Dowager Empress.
sentences.chinese: 每個版面背面有太后的皇家會標。

sentences.english: At the same time Empress Wang sent envoys to Rome …
sentences.chinese: 王太后並曾派人至羅馬上書教皇及耶穌總會長。

sentences.english: He suggested as much to the Queen Mother but met with a negative response.
sentences.chinese: 他向王太后提出這個建議，卻收到否定的迴應。

definition: the emperor/Your majesty the emperor/His imperial majesty
Taishang Huang/Retired Emperor/father of the reigning emperor/fig. puppet master
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
Princess Taiping (c. 665-713), Tang Dynasty princess, politically powerful and known for her beauty
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
